We both agree it was the nicest place we've had the pleasure to stay at! I am in Eureka a few times a year and hope to be able to stay at Kristie's again.

review_text: Immaculate in every way. Traveling for business and it met every need. I brought my puppy and it was perfect, enclosed kitchen with hardwood floors, with a great backyard that offered lots of privacy. Owners provided older towels for the dog to dry off after a walk in the rain. Human towels were soft and big. The bathroom was accommodating and taking a long bath after driving from Portland, OR was sublime. Clean, close to the downtown area, yet also private, and off the main road. Fast wifi and I was able to order MOD PIZZA via UBER EATS while I did work and watched TV. Lastly, from the couch to the bed, all the furniture was well kept and comfortable. I will look for this booking again when I come through next month, thank you! Loved it!

Loved our time here. It was a small, cute little find. Pat was very flexible with us as we had initially said we would arrive an hour after check-in time but ended up arriving right at check-in. Her place was spotless, felt safe and secluded. I enjoyed our stay with ample things to do in the surrounding area, and plenty of recommendations that Pat had put pamphlets of in the space.
I feel as though it was very worth the price and great to have Pat so close and responsive on messages when needed. The bed for myself (being a little bit tall) and my partner was a slightly crammed and a little worn, but we still slept quite soundly and stay very warm on the quite cold nights while we stayed. The space heater within the room really helped out and warmed us up quickly. After not seeing a cat throughout the entire stay, we did end up seeing a cat on our very last morning there which we were very happy about.
Many thanks Pat and hope to see you and the cats again in the future!

The room was perfect for our little getaway. 2 people fit comfortably with small carry ons. The room was very clean and fun. Loved the beach decor. Pat paid attention to all the little details from small Dixie cups to rinse with in the bathroom, emergency travel supplies, small snacks and beverages and fancy hand soaps. She customized a greeting sign in the backyard and included sparkling wine for my birthday. Very sweet gesture. The location was close to the sequoia park zoo and was about a 5 minute drive to everywhere within Eureka. She had a list of great suggestions on local restaurants. The motion sensor lights and the cats did not bother us at all. The neighborhood felt safe and peaceful with a nice view of the eureka water tower in the distance. There was ample parking in front of the house. All in all, wonderful stay and a wonderful host! I would definitely return! Thanks!

review_text: I stayed in the Green Room at Vadas and really enjoyed her minimalist style and thoughtful layout. Also I liked the water craft with yummy water and coffee pot for fresh coffee in the morning. There is a boiler or furnace thing that clangs at night but didn't bother me. Also regarding Eureka in general, the edges of town are much nicer than the center. The center of Eureka they have "let that go" as the expression goes. The edges of Eureka like where Vada lives are nice victorians and good restaurants and (oddly enough) there are quite a few sequias and redwoods right in town to admire! Anyway if you're looking for a place to stay in Eureka, which obviously you are if you are reading this, then I recommend Vadas Green Room.

Shin & Tonyâ€™s place was awesome! The space was easy to get into, very clean and felt like home upon entering. They provided a binder full of helpful information and suggestions for local eats and activities. The couch and bed were very clean and comfy so it was easy to relax after a day of exploring. The bedroom had a nice view of the sunset with a peek of the bay. The window shades were nice because you can adjust open the top and block the bottom of the window to allow sunlight into the room during the morning without feeling exposed to the outside neighborhood. The location was walking distance to local eats and drinks, and a short drive away to the market and Costco I needed anything.
Shin and Tony were very responsive when I messages them and even recommended a local event that was happening during my stay. They provided clear instructions which made checking in and out effortless. I would definitely stay here again when visiting the area, itâ€™s well worth the stay.

review_text:
We were delighted to meet Shin & Tony and stay at their adorable place. They've restored it beautifully.
The esthetics were wonderful. It's obvious they put considerable time and attention to detail decorating and filling the place with beautiful mid century modern furniture, sweet hand picked pieces, and a well stocked kitchen and bathroom. It was comfortable, inviting and we felt quite at home. Tony's choice of plants is lovely and ads a feeling of aliveness.
Their openness and easy accessibility were appreciated and endearing, lending itself to an intimate experience. We really enjoyed connecting.
The dogs have individual personalities and we enjoyed them too.
The full fledged vegetable garden was overflowing in greenness. It was
kind of them to offer to share it's goodness (and asian pears).
There's a nice health food store just down the street.
It's easy to stay in Eureka and visit the Redwoods. So rejuvenating. Reverence to be with beauty, more space and trees than people, and listening to wind in the trees. A deep serenity and stillness.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
March 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is the perfect home base for exploring the Redwoods! We stayed for six days and the apartment was just right for the two of us. The kitchen is well-stocked and the fridge was large enough to hold all of our food (due to COVID we of course brought all of our meals); the gas stove and oven take time getting used to if you don't normally cook with gas, but the pots and pans were solid and dependable and easy to clean. The shower takes a bit to heat up, but since it was just the two of us we didn't run out of hot water, even when we took showers back to back. The internet is lightning fast! We spent our evenings continuing our pandemic binges, and during the week I had a few Zoom meetings and there were no problems connecting. We didn't get a chance to check out most of the local spots, because we've been very COVID-conscious, but we went to the Cafe Marina and Woodley's Bar on the marina and we felt comfortable. It was the first bar we've been to in over a year! We sat outside and kept our masks on, and the staff did an excellent job of making us feel safe. If you're looking for a cozy place to stay and relax during quarantine (and after!) look no further.

Chez Shony was a great place to stay - the perfect size, very cozy, comfortable and warm, and has a full kitchen complete with an electric water kettle, French press, full spice rack, cooking utensils, pots of many sizes, aluminum foil, and much more. The full kitchen made it very economical and is rare when traveling. It was also very clean. There are many nice details like the beautiful wood kitchen table and the art on the walls. We wouldnâ€™t mind having a place like Chez Shony ourselves.
FYI the kitchen has a pocket door, so if two people are working from home, one can sit in the living room and one at the kitchen table and have some noise separation.
Shin and Tony have a very cool food garden which the place looks out on. Downtown Eureka was a short walk away, and we also biked to Sequoia park, hiked Arcata Community Forest and went to Luftenholtz beach for tidepooling 20-30 min north, all of which we recommend.

review_text:
My husband and I just stayed here for one night of our California road trip honeymoon, and let me tell you, I wish we were able to stay the entire trip here! We are very introverted/private people, so the simple and contact-free check-in was super convenient. We also received ample instructions from booking to check-in and out, so we always knew what to expect and never had any issues getting in and out. It was so peaceful and private and we wished we would have had longer to spend here.
I came across the Airbnb listing a few years ago when it went "viral" and I saved the screenshot, knowing I wanted to visit one day. Now that it has happened, we were even more impressed than we anticipated. I can't rate highly enough!

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Peaceful and unique airbnb to stay at if you are in the Eureka area. You definitely need a car to get around but that was no problem for us because we rented a car to drive up to Redwood National and State Parks anyway (~1hr drive north). The surrounding land for this airbnb was very pleasant and it was nice to see the goats and dogs and cat =) Even though the studio is on a property shared with other inhabitants (another airbnb and the hosts' residence), it still felt like we had a private space and didn't have to worry about being "bothered" by anyone else there. I wish we were able to get a tour but we had plenty to do in Eureka and up at the redwood forests, and otherwise we just spent the time relaxing in the outdoor chairs or watching TV in the studio. The town of Eureka is a 10-15min drive away but there were lots of restaurants and grocery stores in there, which was convenient. Definitely would recommend this spot as a home-base if you are going to be in Northern California!

Having visited a couple of cannabis farms in the area, Michaela's place stood out as the first solid structure I had stayed in for a week rather than a tent!
The check-in instructions were extremely clear and easy to follow. I was helpfully accommodated on a farm tour the morning of my arrival day but long before check-in, which was great help. The tour was very informative and Emilio quite a character!
When I did check in the place was clean, the welcome gifts much appreciated and of great quality, the bed was comfortable and the decor and literature around the cabin fascinating.
I would not hesitate to return, preferably with my family.
Please support these invaluable local farmers' businesses!

review_text:
The house is very suitable for a short stay.
The path, from the parking to the cabin, is really a bit too long and completely unlit at night.
It leads in the middle of a sloping slope, with a meadow. Is not well solved, neither to transport the luggage, nor to come back to the cabin at night, accident-free. The outdoor lighting in the cabin is also too dark. You can't see enough or sit outside. It's just too dark. The other buildings on the farm have significantly better outdoor lighting and safe paths.
Unfortunately, there were no animals on site, the enclosures were empty and abandoned.
The hosts are very kind and you can always find a point of contact. Overall nice, for a weekend.

Stayed about a week
review_text: This is a beautifully decorated & well renovated house, with wide off street parking, for about 2 cars. The mattresses are comfortably firm (not too soft) & the bedrooms have privacy curtains. The entire house is sparkling clean. During my stay, I worked virtually, & the WIFI is strong. The kitchen is also well-stocked. On colder days, the newer central heating is efficient & quiet. There are plenty of towels, in each bathroom. There are also board games & cards, for adults & kids. The backyard is fenced in & there is a small deck, with outdoor seating & a grill. This is a great house, for a family with children or a group of friends or for business travelers. The house is close to Hwy 101, if you are driving North or South, to explore the Redwoods or just visiting the general area. The neighborhood felt safe, & there is also plenty of shopping nearby. Most importantly, the host is very kind & proactive, to ensure your stay is relaxing & enjoyable.

This was our first time staying at an Airbnb. We really had no idea what to expect.
Turns out everything was great. All communication was done via e-mail. Our host was always responsive and very accommodating. We had a last-minute change which she handled perfectly.
When we arrived, the place looked brand new. The house was definitely just remodeled and was very inviting. The key was in a lock box just like was described. Once we walked in the front door, we noticed everything was brand new. All new flooring, doors, windows, moldings, fresh paint, cabinets, furniture, and appliances. The bathrooms were also remodeled and spotless! Everything we needed was supplied. The kitchen was stocked with silverware, pots, pans, mixing bowels utensils. All of it. We needed nothing! There were plenty of towels and toiletries in the bathrooms. They also have two washers and two dryers.
To sum our stay up, everything was great! Based on this experience, we will definitely try and Airbnb again!

First off, Kristine greeted us when we arrived and gave us some additional tips for 'must sees' in the area. There were many nice touches in the suite, starting with it smelled good! The space is well laid out with the lounging space with a view of the back yard and trees, the well stocked kitchen and large bedroom and bathroom. The bed was comfortable with nice bedding. There were candles, throw blankets, food essentials and snacks, and books and games. The Forest Suite was so cozy! We had morning coffee on the deck, soaking in the country-like neighborhood. I would 100% come back to stay and 100% recommend this place to family, friends, and basically anyone visiting the Eureka/Arcata area. It would be an excellent option for visiting parents of Cal Poly Humboldt students or anyone staying for a little bit in the area. Thank you for creating this amazing space.

There was a mixup with our rental car, so the first day we spent on foot and there was a little grocery within walking distance and the next day we walked to town for breakfast at a local bagel shop and then to the car rental place. Great weather for walking and anything else you might want to do. Loved it and would absolutely stay again! Highly recommend.

What a lovely home! We thoroughly enjoyed our four-day stay. We would have our morning coffee in the tree room looking at the redwoods, make breakfast in the well-stocked kitchen, and spend the days exploring the redwoods north and south. Eurekaâ€™s central location was perfect for that. We also were able to easily get groceries at Safeway to cook dinners to enjoy in the house, and eat out at Brick & Fire the night we didnâ€™t cook. The living room was comfortable and well set-up for evening movies. And the beds were comfortable and having two bathrooms was very convenient.
Any travelers this summer should read up on the Last Chance Grade construction project between Klamath and Crescent City and plan travel accordingly. We avoided the area as much as possible because it takes a long time to get through even during the â€œopenâ€ hours.
The hostâ€™s communication and directions were excellent. A true gem.

All our meals at local establishments were very good served by friendly, welcoming staff. Eureka is also centrally located for those who, like us, want to hike through and explore the Redwood forests. An added bonus was the local skywalk in Sequoia Zoo and a walking ghost tour that shared Eureka history in a fun way. We always felt safe wherever we went. The unit itself was clean and well appointed, quite ample in size, with a historic theme as Sarah created the space by renovating the top floor of one of Eurekaâ€™s historic buildings. The renovation is a blend of the old and new. Access was easy with a convenient elevator. Sarah was always friendly, knowledgeable, quick to respond, and is clearly fastidious and organized. Perfect.

review_text: Ideally located in the heart of Victorian Old Town with unobstructed views of Woodley Island, The Penthouse is the iconic place to stay when in Eureka. The Penthouse occupies the entire 4th floor of a historic 1884 building and is on the National Register of Historic Places. This historic beauty is on full display in The Penthouse with exquisitely preserved wood floors, doors, ceiling beams and brick. It is spacious with luxe accommodations throughout. True to its online description. Huge windows provide direct views of the bay. We enjoyed watching daily activity of commercial fishing boats, crew boats, and a variety of shore birds. We appreciated being in the Old Town core with walking ease to all it has to offer. Sarah is a proactive, highly responsive and gracious host. She made us feel prepared, welcome and pampered in every way. The Penthouse is an extraordinary gem and will be the ONLY place for us to stay when visiting the Redwood coast!
